intro: Nanooravia, commonly known as the moonflower of the Andes, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, night-blooming white petals that emit a subtle fragrance. The plant has small, clustered leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its botanical classification places it within the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants. Due to its unique blooming pattern and limited habitat, Nanooravia is considered a vulnerable species.
